descript.abstract: World Agriculture is a polygon theme representing agriculture areas worldwide. Attribute information includes the type of agriculture and the environmental impact of that type.
descript.purpose: For educational, non-commercial purposes. This dataset is appropriate for use in a GIS.
descript.supplinf: Land is a basic resource for agriculture. Diverse natural, social, and economic conditions in different regions of the earth give rise to diverse types of agriculture. The main impact of agricultural activity on the environment occurs through the technological processes of cultivation and animal breeding. It is important to identify and assess the impact in order to establish a rational system of agriculture that is friendly to the environment.

procstep.procdesc: Agricultural activities differ by specialization, mechanization, and technologies of cultivation and animal breeding. In this atlas the world's agriculture is classified into 14 major types according to statistical data on agricultural production, mechanization, and farm labor, as well as according to maps of crop and livestock distribution and land use structure. Each major type is characterized by its environmental impact. The environmental impacts of the major types were assessed by experts using the following data: cultivation methods, types of crop rotation, use of mineral and organic fertilizers and chemicals, irrigation and drainage, and the number of livestock per unit area of pasture. Environmental impacts were classified into four categories: weak, moderate, strong, and very strong. Responses of the environment to the impact were taken into account during classification.
